name: Nineteen Eighty-four.
description:
This deck is a thought experiment on what Snoop's niche in the game of A:NR is. There is ice you want to rez to stop the runner, and there is ice you want to force the runner to run over and over again. Snoop is one of the latter. To make the runner run, you need to have high profile cards in a remote server with Snoop in front of it. SanSan City Grid, agendas, and usually Jackson Howard are good reasons to run a server with Snoop protecting it. The question is, "How does a Corp leverage this information?" Upon a few test games, I've scored Restructured Datapool and locked the runner into poverty. I have utilized Snoop as a credit drain to keep runs infrequent and assets/upgrades safe. I have even flatlined a runner with Ronin after the player had seen the deck in action.

The deck definitely needs work with Sherlock 1.0, Snoop, and SanSan City Grid all costing 6cr each in a fairly poor faction, but it has been a blast to play lately.

name: big money big problems
description: testing bad deck

name: big money big problems 2.0
ICEland v3.4.1
description: Decided on the Melanges...worked out pretty decently in the store tournament I was in yesterday, so I think I'm solid for the time being. :)

name: Shape of a Criminal v4.2.1
description: Instituted a Garrote into this one, saying bye-bye to Ninja! Also thinking about trying to squeeze Feint in as well...just not sure where that one can go, at the moment (and keep the 40 card size). Yes, I MUST have my cake and eat it too! :P

name: Date on a bench
description:
For the last months I played a really aggressive Chaos Theory deck with SMC + Account Siphon + Indexing. It worked very well but eventually I got bored with it. Its aggressivity somehow became tiresome. But I couldn’t figure out what else to play. I built an Andromeda control deck with a lot of connection (Logos, Bad Publicity exploit) that is quite challenging and interesting to play, but tiresome again. Other decks out there weren’t looking like things I wanted to play. Interesting maybe, sometimes even inspired, but not for me. So I took a break in order to reboot my brain’s Netrunner part. Two weeks without thinking about combos, tweaking deck ideas or looking for new strategies.

Then I saw her: Oracle May.

She is great. But like every other woman she has a catch. Some might even say two: you risk trashing your own cards and you show the Corp what you are going to play. I don’t think the latter is really something negative. In fact, I think it is a powerful psychological trick: the more the Corp player thinks about what possibilities you have with your cards, the more he forgets his own game plan. It’s an information overload. The Corp sees everything, but doesn’t. Hiding in plain sight, remember? So the one thing I want to negate is the destructive part of her ability. And I want to do that as much as possible and with as few cards as possible.

The first card that came to everybody’s mind was Motivation of course. But that is a combo setup. It takes time and effort to put together quickly. I wanted to avoid that because combos suck. I want reliability, not something like “if I have this card and if I can play this other one before it, this magical thing will happen. But only if I have enough credits, the Corp didn’t play this card, etc, etc, etc…” You get my point? The more “ifs”, the more you have to think of things that could go wrong with your combo. Combos are not reliable.

Personal opinion: I want to play Netrunner, not “think” it. Thinking is bad; especially in tournament situations (or maybe I’m just not smart enough, who knows?).

To reliably use Oracle May’s ability means running a majority of one type of card. This way I can name that every turn with little to no negative effect. I’m not planning to play a Professor deck, so event cards were the logical choice (though that Professor deck does sound interesting). In addition to that I needed something to save Oracle May’s mispredictions out of the heap.

My first reflex was to try her out with Chaos Theory, because my last deck already had program recursion built in it with Clone Chips and Test Runs. The small size of the decks also means getting Oracle May quite reliably. So I took out some programs, the hardware tricks and put in more events. But I wasn’t happy with it. Influence meant that I missed most of the sweet criminal events. Additionally, it’s an auto-lose to a double Punitive Strike. I didn’t like that. I guess no one does.

So I turned away from Shapers. But I still needed enough influence for the recursion tricks. Who has the most influence in Criminals? Ken "Express" Tenma! And in addition to that, he makes all the run events cheaper! He is perfect:

  • 17 influence. I still want more, but at least I can nullify Oracle’s negative effect well enough.

  • I have access to all the criminal events, including tutors to “save” the few cards I don’t want Oracle May to trash.

  • The run events are cheaper.

  • Theophilius Bagbiter protects me against flatlines.

So let’s take a look at it:

Influence:

2 x Test Run. Recursion + tutor. What’s not to like. Twice, because once is not reliable enough.

1 x Retrieval Run. It’s a run event, so you can play it from your stack thanks to Planned Assault.

1 x Levy AR Lab Access. Reboot all the nice events. You will draw a lot and soon your stack will appear really small. That’s the time for LALA. You may need to play it as soon as you get it though, depending on the risk of damage you might take from the Corp. Losing it can become tricky in the endgame.

2 x Oracle May. 3 might be better, but influence is limited. On the other it’s one less non-event card and we have access to Hostage.

1 x Corroder.

1 x ZU. 13 Key Master. I would prefer Gordian Blade, but influence again…

The events are mostly self-explanatory. I preferred Forged Activation Orders over Emergency Shutdown because in addition to put pressure on the Corp, it gives some control of where its money goes and information. It helps knowing which breaker to tutor first (keeping the pressure on) and it’s really useful if there is Ice over Archives. This way I know which breaker I will need in case I need a Retrieval Run.

2 x Theophilius Bagbiter. He has a nice synergy with Oracle May (you automatically get the credits for the card you just draw plus credits for another card) and protects you from all kind of damage. There are no combo cards in this deck. The only card you may not want to lose is LALA. But be careful, don’t play him carelessly. You must balance your need for credits vs your need for cards (or life points). Sometimes I don’t even play him. Theophilius brings safety to the deck, but also some archenemies: Sweep Weeks and Komainu. He really is match-up dependent. So I may cut one out in favour of something else. Maybe a Femme Fatale. But I’m not sure yet. Any suggestions?

Short playing guide:

The perfect starting hand: Oracle May, Theophilius Bagbiter, a program and Easy Mark. First click: Oracle May Second click: Theophilius Bagbiter Third click: Draw with Oracle May Forth click: Easy Mark

And you are set. You can replace one of the connections with a Hostage, since the Easy Mark is enough in order to keep your cards with Bagbiter.

The first thing you always want is to install Oracle May. Then you will want your rig. Forged Activation Orders helps you to choose the right program and start pressuring the Corp as you search for your complete rig. If you don’t have Theophilius in your starting hand, you don’t HAVE to install him at all. It really depends on the match up. Keep the Easy Marks back, if you can. They make the install so much easier.

From there on the decks is really easy to play. There are no real combos in this deck. Just many cards that have nice synergies, like Ken making the run events cheaper (13 from 38 events, that 13 credits right there), Theophilius and May, the tutors, …

Simple and easy. I love it.

First click is Oracle May, then you go on from there, depending on the events you have. Sometimes you won't even have better things to do than click for credits.

Don’t be afraid to click for money.

I would really love The Maker’s Eye, but I don’t feel comfortable cutting one Test Run or the Retrieval Run for it. I also thought about Déjà Vu, which would also help if I lose LALA. But again, I don’t feel like cutting the Retrieval Run. It is so much more reliable thanks to Planned Assault.

I would love to know what you think about it. If you have questions, don’t hesitate.

Have a good one.

Elstyr.

name: ICE Tamer v2
description: Revised Nasir deck. Comments welcome.

name: VAMPire DONUTS!
description:
Slight adaptation of the popular donuts deck.

Removed a little economy and the public sympathies to add vamp, plascrete and xanadu.

Didn't like the lack of scorched/punitive defense, especially against NBN. The previous deck would have you draw lots of cards to defend, which would just help sweeps week.

Xanadu continues the economy denial theme. ICE is expensive to rez, prone to being killed by parasite datasucker and then if you get through to HQ hit them with a vamp. Donuts makes post vamp recovery very hard especially combined with xanadu.

Not sure if there is enough economy now though, need to do some testing.

name: Gloria Foster
description: I ran a shaper motivation/oracle deck but it was slow. After thinking about how varied event cards are I asked the question if a heavy event build could be plausible. As a huge ETF fan I love a free credit and Ken seemed to fit the bill. The idea is to get Oracle May out and just always guess "event". Get your breakers out when needed and use Levy Lab Access to reshuffle economy/utility events. I LOVE THIS DECK! So far it has really blow me away at how much it keeps you rich and the corp poor.

name: Professor Ready For Anything
description:
I feel that the professor was an interesting id but lacking cards to make actually useful, however i think that now hes becoming more viable so i thought id build a deck for him.

Keyhole, Imp and Deus X are in to make short work of key cards and punish high trap Jinteki players, no fear of junebug with 3 counters on when you have a Deus X.

Nerve and medium allow R&D and HQ punishment.

Djinn is an obvious choice here allowing you to look for what ever virus you feel you need at the time.

2 different breaker suites plus Femme, Knight and sneakdoor for good measure.

Scavenge is a key card in this deck as it dose so much for you. allows testrun combo play, transitioning from one breaker suite to another, reusing imps / moving Femme tokens, or a seudo clone chip with something you no longer need.

Diesel, Quality Time & Express lowers your reliance on testrun's & SMC's and work well with freelance.

Freelance... now this was originally sure gamble as i don't like free lance but it seems right here so i swapped them over (begrudgingly).

Toolbox what can i say its amazing, 2MU is needed in here 2 link helps alot as-well and free creds is always nice. as much as i like desparado this is a better fit (which is good cos i couldn't have it in here if i wanted to)

Same old thing great card but sadly was last on my hit list of cards to put in otherwise id take 3.

1 major flaw i feel this deck has is a major reliance on opus for cash. id like to put pro contacts in but currently i feel i need everything that's in it maybe i will find something that i can trade out as i test the deck more.

Feel free to comment

name: Shadow of your former glory
Run on HQ
description: First Criminal Deck

name: Demolition Man 1.5
Kate Regionals
description: Shaper strengths powered by Magic Magnum Opus Money

name: Kate Regionals
Honor and Profit - Jinteki "Harmony Medtech" - Starting Deck
description: This is the pre-constructed Corp starting deck that comes with the Honor and Profit Deluxe expansion.

name: Honor and Profit - Criminal "Iain Stirling" - Starting Deck
description: This is the pre-constructed Runner starting deck that comes with the Honor and Profit Deluxe expansion.

name: Everybody eats when they come to my Haas.
description: My first deck to be used against people I don't know. Trial and inevitable Error.

name: Annihilation 1.0
description:
Complete and utter destruction. We already know that Weyland is great at trashing programs but with the release of the Lunar cycle why should you just stop at their rig when you can decimate their entire side of the field!

Midseason over SEA Source to reliably land not just one but several tags with a higher trace. The runner's only option is to either spend precious clicks and money getting rid of them or just float them, giving you plenty of time to destroy in the meantime. Over scoring an Atlas early in the game to fetch Midseasons would be ideal.

Once tagged, Bad Times + Power Shutdown + several ICE take care of those pesky programs while Taurus gets rid of their Consoles and finally Freelancer trashes Kati and any other precious resources. No amount of Deja Vus or Clone Chips can save them from that large of a deficit and then it's time to pump out agendas like there's no tomorrow.

name: Weyland Killer
Run on HQ
Teaching Corp
description: A basic corp deck designed for teaching netrunner.

name: Tenma - Not Half Bad
description: The idea behind this deck is to try and keep the Corp poor by forcing them to rez ICE when they can't or destroying high-cost ICE as you go. Only a couple Icebreakers as you can tutor them with Special Order or bring them back from the dead using Clone Chip. Levy to stop yourself from decking yourself (something I've done with this), otherwise abuse those Run events!

name: Project Jehova - Shinra Electric Power Company
description:
This deck style is commonly known as RedCoats, but really it's just your regular taxing deck that I've used since I started playing 2 years ago. I had so much fun with it that I wanted to publish it.

More often than not I'm swimming in MMC/Corporate war credits.

Power Shutdown might strike as an odd inclusion and it might be a meta call in this case, it's to deal with datasuckers (fuck you and eat that viktor, Yog) and E3 Feedback Implants.

Jackson helps with ABT and Power Shutdown.

Efficiency Committee works to get some extra action when using MMC and purging, or both. 14 credits in a single turn with MMC is pretty cool too.

name: Stronger Together
Patient Zero
description: Concept Parasite recursion deck with Noise.

name: Teaching Deck: Shaper
description: Shaper teaching deck built from the excess cards of three core sets. If the influence choices seem slightly strange, it is because the cards are shared between this and a Criminal teaching deck. The corporate counterparts are Weyland and Haas-Bioroid.

name: Teaching Deck: Criminal
description: Criminal teaching deck built from the excess cards of three core sets. If the influence choices seem slightly strange, it is because the cards are shared between this and a Shaper teaching deck. The corporate counterparts are Weyland and Haas-Bioroid.

name: Teaching Deck: Weyland
description: Weyland teaching deck built from the excess cards of three core sets. If the influence choices seem slightly strange, it is because the cards are shared between this and a Haas-Bioroid teaching deck. The runner counterparts are Criminal and Shaper.

name: Teaching Deck: Haas-Bioroid
description: Haas-Bioroid teaching deck built from the excess cards of three core sets. If the influence choices seem slightly strange, it is because the cards are shared between this and a Weyland teaching deck. The runner counterparts are Criminal and Shaper.

name: Prepaid Katman
Tennin Chain Lightning
Kate VP
HB Red Brain
Core Set HB
description:
A deck I used for my first attempt at deck building. I played against my brother who chose Criminals (we did not know which faction the other person was while we were building decks, and we both agreed to only use the Core Set, with only 2 Core Sets available between the two of us).

The game went well considering it was my first attempt at deck building and my brother has played a few more games than me. He ended up winning by 1 point. Early game he scored a couple agendas, then I caught up to 6 agenda points, then he won the game when I made the mistake of trying to rush a Priority Requisition at game point instead of use the Aggressive Secretary that I had in my hand.

The ICE did really well here though. Data Raven, Tollbooth, and Heimdall all worked out very well. In hindsight, I wish I had replaced one of the Data Raven's with a second Tollbooth since he didn't mind taking some tags toward the end of the game. Archer, unfortunately, never got played since it was the bottom card of my R&D. But overall, most of the game he had a problem being able to run on any server since I had tons of ICE and no issues rezzing them.

I thought I would have a problem having enough credits using this deck, but actually I almost always had plenty, which made me look quite foolish when he played an account siphon on me and got 10 credits.

Any advice for improvement or constructive criticism would be much appreciated! Just try to go easy on me, since I've only played about 6 or 7 games total. I may update and revise this deck once my brother and I throw in a few of the data packs that I own.

name: Mind the Kid 2.0
description:
Spend the first few turns getting Deep Red & e3 Feedback Implants out while face-checking ice. Economy can be an issue when ice starts stacking up so use the parasites to help control servers. I tend to use them on stronger ice then insta-killing a strength 0 ice. Snowball is there for wrap-around; Deus X is primarily there for swordsman.

The first version ran 3 Self-modifying Code along with Test Run, Clone Chip, & Scavenge. But I found that running all 4 is overkill; I might try running with Self-modifying Code instead of Test Run.

Instead of 3 Parasite, you could run either 2 Inside Job or 3 Bishop.

Feedback welcome!

name: Shocking Shutdowns
Tabloid Reporter 2.0
description:
While the runner is playing around a possible SeaScorch (that doesn't actually exist in this deck), you can start removing key pieces of the the runner's strategy by using Invasion of Privacy, Snoop, Data Hound, and Character Assassination. There is nothing quite like playing Hedge Fund, Invasion of Privacy at trace 8 against Andy turn 1.

I may pull Aggressive Secretary & 1 Flare for Primary Transmission Dish when Upstalk is released.

Feedback welcome!
